course_title: Freshman Seminar:Economics: Economics of Money Laundering
class_notes: This course examines the mechanics of money laundering using the tools of economic analysis to provide insights into public policy on AML (anti-money laundering). Topics covered include the criminal enterprise value chain, the role of gatekeepers, and the influence of the structure of economic incentives (deterrence measures, the ethics of belief, and the calculus of costs and benefits).
course_description: Open only to students with freshman standing. Topics and prerequisites vary; consult the Course Atlas.
sections: Class Nbr: 2641, Section #: 2, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 10-11:15a, Instructor: M. Ayogu, Status: Open
